Przez większość czasu, jaki poświęciłem tej grze kląłem w duszy wyzywając od najgorszych tę produkcję, bo:
- mimo dobrego wejścia gra po niedługim czasie się nuży: starcia są monotonne i nudne, ci sami przeciwnicy, na podobnych hubach, atakujący falami.
- rozwój broni skopany: brak statystyk broni, losowość w dropieniu spluw, sprawia, że trudno się zdecydować na rozwój broni. Źle zbalansowana ilość gotówki nie pozwala rozwinąć kilku spluw oraz mocy. Przeszedłem całą grę używając praktycznie schotguna i snajperki, plazmidów sporadycznie. No właśnie moce były tak słabe, że faktycznie nie było sensu ich używać.
- skopane środowiskowe historie: niewygodnie się je ogarnia, ja bardzo szybko przestałem je śledzić. W menu były nie do końca przetłumaczone albo ja nie potrafię przewijać tekstu.
- klimat: w porównaniu do pierwszych dwóch Bioshocków to tutaj klimacik jest bardzo miałki. Rzecz gustu, ale jeśli oczekujesz klaustrofobicznych ciśnień, wszędobylskiego zagrożenia i mroku, to nie tutaj. Wolałem dwie pierwsze części.

Ponarzekałem i dałem łapkę w górę, bo fabuła jest zajebista i ratuje rzutem na taśmę tego średniaka. Jednak i w tej beczce miodu...mianowicie fabuła jest nielogiczna.

What an absolute (and I usually hate this word, but) casualized mess of a game this is. The story so far is ok, the art and setting is beautiful. Such a great contrast to the secular city and ideology of Rapture. The gameplay, though. While it feels good, it feels like an extended tutorial mode. The game is constantly holding your hands. Low on health, Elizabeth can pull a health kit out of her -wherever and give it to you. Need salts? "Here, catch!" said Elizabeth for the 100th time in under 15mins. No Elizabeth, I actually didn't need salts, since every 2 steps I take in this game, I'm stumbling on one or two glowing blue salt vials. Same for ammo, same for health kits, she even finds money for you. Am I escorting Elizabeth or is she or rather the game escorting me? Also, on top of everything, the AI in this game is absolute trash. When the enemy soliders aren't stumbling out of cover, for no reason, they are standing around doing nothing. Sometimes with Elizabeth right next to them, doing the same thing. When you first rescue her, the game gives a message saying something along the lines of "You don't have to worry about her, she can take care of herself in a fight". It now makes sense, I don't have to worry about her because the AI doesn't even go after her apparently, unless it's scripted. I'll never understand why developers do this. Well, I do, it's so they can make more money, lol. Which as a company you can't really blame them, but damn, what a fall from grace. Save your money.

对我来说生化奇兵：无限是一款优缺点很明显的游戏。
游戏塑造了一个美好的世界，然而中后期急转直下的节奏让你无暇欣赏。战斗系统乏善可陈，看似丰富的异能系统实则大同小异，本质上还是一款传统的FPS游戏。整体难度也不大，毕竟你有异能有套装还有伊丽莎白，而那些杂兵，他们什么都没有。而且你死了可以无限复活，但杂兵不会，人海战术也敌不过车轮战XD。游戏里主要的难度来自于视角，空轨系统的加入对于晕FPS的人简直是灾难！哥伦比亚不欢迎晕3D的人！
剧情是精彩的，但是得用心体会。游戏自带中文字幕，但机翻痕迹明显，因此想了解剧情的话你可以不捡弹药不捡钱，但是一定要收集影像资料，不然直到通关你都会一头雾水。这是一个关于轮回时空救赎战争反乌托邦量子物理的故事，只有在游玩过程中充分了解剧情背景，才能感受结局带来的震撼。

然而短发的伊丽莎白是这游戏最美好的存在，她可以让你忘掉这游戏所有的缺点，冲着伊丽莎白这游戏也值得你通关一次！简单难度过一遍剧情就够了

对于主界面的after  you've gone,以及dlc里的la vie en rose有莫名的好感，虽然说剧情一知半解，我感觉足矣。也难以用晦涩的笔调写出什么深沉的感悟，只是知道哥伦比亚并不是个好地方，就如鲁侍萍眼里的无锡一般。可能以后仍然是会起了兴致而再去那里体味一番的，但日子已然是久远的了，终归还是难以理解灯塔所代表的是何等事物，始于它，也终于它。流程中康姆斯托克对于自身的歌功颂德戏谑而又有些真实，终归是不知道，也不敢知道是哪个与其相似了。康姆斯托克：“哥伦比亚是个好地方。” “呵，好地方。”争这一个Elizabeth，为了什么呢。

Had this back on XB360 before I ascended from peasantry and I put many hours into this game. Simply put, I didn't enjoy the "enclosed" feeling of Bioshock 1 & 2 Call it whatever you want, I wouldn't say phobia because I'm fine with small spaces. It's really just the whole underwater "There's a whole sunken metropolis" thing. I also find Atlantis to be a pretty dull subject, sue me. I tried so many times to enjoy them and I've almost beaten both at this point but it has taken years to get to that point, and now, I just don't really care enough to finish them. 

In rolls Bioshock Infinite where instead you are on a floating city. Yeah, you're still stranded but at least you can breathe in the fresh air (whatever oxygen may exist that high up). I can't really say much about the little details of the game itself from memory at this point, because it has been a few years since I've played and beaten this game. But I remember starting it up for the first time and not sleeping that night. Everything about it amazed me compared to the previous games, which are still great in terms of story and content. It may have been the parallels and connections with American History (history major) in conjunction with the pseudo-fascist culture of Columbia, or it could be the semi-industrious half-baked concept of floating cities carried by zeppelins, or it could be the absolutely insane style of animation that Irrational Games used. The whole "Save the girl, save the world" cliche may be a bit played out but it's done so in such a way that only Irrational could do. They managed to harness a metric fuck tonne of creativity simply in the connection between Booker and Elizabeth. The ending, every bittersweet second of it, left me staring at my wall for a while as the credits rolled. 

Truly a 10/10 from me. Sooner or later I'll return to Rapture and finish playing Atlas Shrugged Simulator.
